page.title: 06LOCAL CHURCHES,CONNEL
page.content: St.Oran's,the parish church,is a traditional stone building.Built in 1888,it is a replica of Iona Abbey.On the bell in the tower are the words_"a gift from JSR 1891". Sunday services are held at 1100 in St.Oran's and 1830 in Dunbeg. Sunday School is held in the Church Hall_built in 1898 it used to be the United Free Church.About 22 children attend Sunday School.Around 12 older children attend Bible Class.The Women's Guild involves about 30 women. A meeting is held weekly for prayer and Bible Study. St.Louis and St.Margaret is a small Roman Catholic chapel built in 1935.A service is held at 1000 each Sunday.The chapel is served by a priest who stays in the village of Taynuilt.
